SEARCH
Package utility

Class InputValidator

java.lang.Object
utility.InputValidator
public class InputValidator extends Object
A utility class for validating and obtaining user input from the console. Provides methods for validating integers, doubles, strings, patterns, dates, times, and other specific input formats such as IDs, emails, and phone numbers.
Since:
2024-11-21

  • Method Details

    • getIntegerInput

      public static int getIntegerInput(String prompt, int min, int max)
      Prompts the user to enter an integer within a specified range.
      Parameters:
      prompt - the message to display to the user
      min - the minimum allowable value
      max - the maximum allowable value
      Returns:
      the validated integer input

    • getDoubleInput

      public static double getDoubleInput(String prompt, double min, double max)
      Prompts the user to enter a double within a specified range.
      Parameters:
      prompt - the message to display to the user
      min - the minimum allowable value
      max - the maximum allowable value
      Returns:
      the validated double input

    • getPatternedInput

      public static String getPatternedInput(String prompt, String pattern, String errorMessage)
      Prompts the user to enter a string matching a specific pattern.
      Parameters:
      prompt - the message to display to the user
      pattern - the regex pattern for validation
      errorMessage - the error message to display if validation fails
      Returns:
      the validated string input

      public static boolean getConfirmation(String prompt)

      Returns:
      true for "yes", false for "no"

    • getConsultationNotes

      public static String getConsultationNotes(String prompt)
      Prompts the user to enter consultation notes. The input ends when "END" is typed on a new line.
      Parameters:
      prompt - the message to display to the user
      Returns:
      the consultation notes as a string
